column4: I have a quick question, i'm getting an error up "Your kernel sources cannot be found.  Kernel headers found...  They does not match your running kernel." when i run a configure.sh script.  I'm not running a special install or anything either... any ideas anyone?
there should be a links /usr/src/linux pointing to kernel sources of current running kernel
then you need to install a kernel, there's prolly a nice ubuntu way to do that
